You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 20. Brāhmaṇavagga
segments.en: 20. Brahmins

segments.pli: 200. Nissāraṇīyasutta
segments.en: 200. Elements of Escape

segments.pli: “Pañcimā, bhikkhave, nissāraṇīyā dhātuyo.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these five elements of escape.

segments.pli: Katamā pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno kāmaṃ manasikaroto kāmesu cittaṃ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati na vimuccati.
segments.en: Take a case where a mendicant focuses on sensual pleasures, but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about them.

segments.pli: Nekkhammaṃ kho panassa manasikaroto nekkhamme cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati.
segments.en: But when they focus on renunciation, their mind is eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ cittaṃ sugataṃ subhāvitaṃ suvuṭṭhitaṃ suvimuttaṃ suvisaṃyuttaṃ kāmehi;
segments.en: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, well freed, and well detached from sensual pleasures.

segments.pli: ye ca kāmapaccayā uppajjanti āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, mutto so tehi, na so taṃ vedanaṃ vediyati.
segments.en: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of sensual pleasures, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.

segments.pli: Idamakkhātaṃ kāmānaṃ nissaraṇaṃ. (1)
segments.en: This is how the escape from sensual pleasures is explained.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno byāpādaṃ manasikaroto byāpāde cittaṃ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati na vimuccati.
segments.en: Take another case where a mendicant focuses on ill will, but their mind isn’t eager …

segments.pli: Abyāpādaṃ kho panassa manasikaroto abyāpāde cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati.
segments.en: But when they focus on good will, their mind is eager …

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ cittaṃ sugataṃ subhāvitaṃ suvuṭṭhitaṃ suvimuttaṃ suvisaṃyuttaṃ byāpādena;
segments.en: Their mind is in a good state … well detached from ill will.

segments.pli: ye ca byāpādapaccayā uppajjanti āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, mutto so tehi, na so taṃ vedanaṃ vediyati.
segments.en: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of ill will, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.

segments.pli: Idamakkhātaṃ byāpādassa nissaraṇaṃ. (2)
segments.en: This is how the escape from ill will is explained.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno vihesaṃ manasikaroto vihesāya cittaṃ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati na vimuccati.
segments.en: Take another case where a mendicant focuses on harming, but their mind isn’t eager …

segments.pli: Avihesaṃ kho panassa manasikaroto avihesāya cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati.
segments.en: But when they focus on compassion, their mind is eager …

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ cittaṃ sugataṃ subhāvitaṃ suvuṭṭhitaṃ suvimuttaṃ suvisaṃyuttaṃ vihesāya;
segments.en: Their mind is in a good state … well detached from harming.

segments.pli: ye ca vihesāpaccayā uppajjanti āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, mutto so tehi, na so taṃ vedanaṃ vediyati.
segments.en: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of harming, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.

segments.pli: Idamakkhātaṃ vihesāya nissaraṇaṃ. (3)
segments.en: This is how the escape from harming is explained.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno rūpaṃ manasikaroto rūpe cittaṃ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati na vimuccati.
segments.en: Take another case where a mendicant focuses on form, but their mind isn’t eager …

segments.pli: Arūpaṃ kho panassa manasikaroto arūpe cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati.
segments.en: But when they focus on the formless, their mind is eager …

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ cittaṃ sugataṃ subhāvitaṃ suvuṭṭhitaṃ suvimuttaṃ suvisaṃyuttaṃ rūpehi;
segments.en: Their mind is in a good state … well detached from forms.

segments.pli: ye ca rūpapaccayā uppajjanti āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, mutto so tehi, na so taṃ vedanaṃ vediyati.
segments.en: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of form, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.

segments.pli: Idamakkhātaṃ rūpānaṃ nissaraṇaṃ. (4)
segments.en: This is how the escape from forms is explained.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno sakkāyaṃ manasikaroto sakkāye cittaṃ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati na vimuccati.
segments.en: Take a case where a mendicant focuses on identity, but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Sakkāyanirodhaṃ kho panassa manasikaroto sakkāyanirodhe cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati.
segments.en: But when they focus on the ending of identity, their mind is eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ cittaṃ sugataṃ subhāvitaṃ suvuṭṭhitaṃ suvimuttaṃ suvisaṃyuttaṃ sakkāyena;
segments.en: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, well freed, and well detached from identity.

segments.pli: ye ca sakkāyapaccayā uppajjanti āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, mutto so tehi, na so taṃ vedanaṃ vediyati.
segments.en: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of identity, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.

segments.pli: Idamakkhātaṃ sakkāyassa nissaraṇaṃ. (5)
segments.en: This is how the escape from identity is explained.

segments.pli: Tassa kāmanandīpi nānuseti, byāpādanandīpi nānuseti, vihesānandīpi nānuseti, rūpanandīpi nānuseti, sakkāyanandīpi nānuseti so kāmanandiyāpi ananusayā, byāpādanandiyāpi ananusayā, vihesānandiyāpi ananusayā, rūpanandiyāpi ananusayā, sakkāyanandiyāpi ananusayā.
segments.en: Delight in sensual pleasures, ill will, harming, form, and identity don’t linger within them.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu niranusayo, acchecchi taṇhaṃ, vivattayi saṃyojanaṃ, sammā mānābhisamayā antamakāsi dukkhassa.
segments.en: That’s why they’re called a mendicant who is without underlying tendencies, who has cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.

segments.pli: Imā kho, bhikkhave, pañca nissāraṇīyā dhātuyo”ti.
segments.en: These are the five elements of escape.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Brāhmaṇavaggo pañcamo.
Soṇo doṇo saṅgāravo,
Kāraṇapālī ca piṅgiyānī;
Supinā ca vassā vācā,
Kulaṃ nissāraṇīyena cāti.
Catuttho paṇṇāsako samatto.

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these five elements of escape.
